headline: Podcast: Hopes for Interest-Rate Cut Lead to Modest Stock Gains
summary: Plus: Shares in the crypto-exchange operator Bullish jumped 84% in their first day of trading. The IPO raised $1.1 billion. And Amazon's news that it's launching same-day grocery delivery caused shares of Kroger, Walmart, DoorDash and Instacart to fall.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Anxiety in the Grocery Space
summary: Amazon plans a massive expansion of its grocery-delivery business, a move to boost growth in one of the few retail arenas in which it doesn’t yet have a dominant position.  Shares of grocery companies fell on the news of Amazon’s expansion, with Instacart-owner Maplebear sinking 12%, DoorDash down 3.8% and Kroger sliding 4.4%.

headline: Why Sprouts (SFM) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of grocery store chain Sprouts Farmers Market (NASDAQ:SFM) fell 3.1% in the morning session after news of increased competition following Amazon's major expansion of its same-day grocery delivery service. Amazon announced it is aggressively expanding its service to more cities, allowing customers to order perishable items like produce, dairy, and meat—directly competing with Sprouts' core business. headline: Amazon grocery, Webtoon & Disney deal, Gildan to buy Hanes
summary: Amazon (AMZN) is expanding its same-day grocery delivery services, sending shares of competitors like Kroger (KR) and Instacart's parent company, Maplebear (CART), lower. Webtoon (WBTN) stock skyrockets after announcing a deal with Disney (DIS). Gildan (GIL) has confirmed plans to buy Hanesbrands (HBI) for $2.2 billion. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Amazon expands its perishable delivery service, putting pressure on traditional grocers
summary: Amazon is now rolling out a service where its Prime members can order their blueberries and milk at the same time as their batteries and other basic items.  The online juggernaut said Wednesday that customers in more than 1,000 cities and towns now have access to fresh groceries with its free Same-Day Delivery on orders over $25 for Prime members, with plans to reach over 2,300 by the end of the year.  The company said that if an order doesn’t meet the minimum, members can still choose same-day delivery for a $2.99 fee.

raw.headline: Amazon expands its perishable delivery service, putting pressure on traditional grocers

The company said that if an order doesn’t meet the minimum, members can still choose same-day delivery for a $2.99 fee.

headline: First National Realty Partners Announces Ross Dress for Less Opening at McAlpin Square in Savannah, Georgia
summary: First National Realty Partners (FNRP), a leading national private equity commercial real estate firm, has announced the opening of Ross Dress for Less at McAlpin Square in Savannah, Georgia. The national off-price retailer opened its doors on July 18 in a 22,000-square-foot space, bringing the center to over 95% leased occupancy and reinforcing its position as a key retail destination in the local market.

headline: Lunchskins Launches Revolutionary Home Compostable Freezer-Safe Storage Bags
summary: In a major leap toward sustainable living, Lunchskins is expanding its trusted line of food storage products with a groundbreaking innovation: Home Compostable, Freezer-Safe Ziptop Storage Bags made from plant-based materials. Launching nationwide in August 2025 at Kroger banner stores, the new line will debut in Sandwich and Gallon sizes.

headline: Kroger’s CEO mysteriously resigned. An unrelated lawsuit involving Jewel could reveal why
summary: As part of his departure, former Kroger CEO Rodney McMullen forfeited all of his unvested equity and bonuses—a total of $11 million.
